title: Cross Compiling for Amiga OS - Error implicit declaration of function 'ioctl'
body:
### I did this

using GCC = m68k-amigaos-gcc version 13.2.0
AmigaSSL v5 (Latest Oct 24)
Zlib 1.3.1 (Cross Compiled with soft-float by me)
In hopes of - Building curl 8.11.1-DEV (m68k-unknown-amigaos) OpenSSL/3.4.0 zlib/1.3.1

The configure command was as follows (this was based on a older forum post and added to make it compile)
`./buildconf && PKG_CONFIG=true ./configure --host=m68k-amigaos --build=$(uname -m)-pc-linux-gnu CC=m68k-amigaos-gcc AR=m68k-amigaos-ar --disable-shared --disable-ipv6 --prefix=/opt/amiga13 --disable-netrc --without-libpsl --with-amissl --disable-threaded-resolver CFLAGS="-fomit-frame-pointer -msoft-float -Wno-system-headers -mcrt=clib2" CPPFLAGS="-D__AMIGA__ -DHAVE_IOCTLSOCKET_CAMEL_FIONBIO=1" LIBS="-lnet -lm -lc -lz -lunix -latomic" `

When trying to cross compile anything above 8.4.0 the cross compile fails with

` CC       libcurl_la-nonblock.lo
nonblock.c: In function 'curlx_nonblock':
nonblock.c:70:10: error: implicit declaration of function 'ioctl' [-Werror=implicit-function-declaration]
   70 |   return ioctl(sockfd, FIONBIO, &flags);
      |          ^~~~~`

this seems to coming from #elif defined(HAVE_IOCTL_FIONBIO) which has comments older unix - there is an Amiga elif further down - If I swap the order in nonblock.c as below - the compile completes (it doesn't work on the amiga correctly however)

```
#elif defined(HAVE_IOCTLSOCKET_CAMEL_FIONBIO) 
    /* Amiga */
    long flags = nonblock ? 1L : 0L;
    return IoctlSocket(sockfd, FIONBIO, (char*)&flags); 

#elif defined(HAVE_IOCTL_FIONBIO)

  /* older Unix versions */
  int flags = nonblock ? 1 : 0;
  return ioctl(sockfd, FIONBIO, &flags);
```


On the Amiga - typing any CURL URL gives the error message

> curl: (3) URL using bad/illegal format or missing URL

I'm not a C programmer or an expert at compiling with GCC  - just thought I'll give this all a try to see if I could make the latest CURL work on the AmigaOS (test system is latest classic AmigaOS 3.2.2.1)

so not sure if there are two bugs here - or my configuration statement is causing this issue.


### I expected the following

Compilation works first try and the Amiga program runs and works as intended.

### curl/libcurl version

curl 8.11.1-DEV (m68k-unknown-amigaos) libcurl/8.11.1-DEV OpenSSL/3.4.0 zlib/1.3.1

### operating system

Linux 5.15.153.1-microsoft-standard-WSL2 #1 SMP Fri Mar 29 23:14:13 UTC 2024 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
Amiga OS 3.2.2.1
